questions.text: An element X forms an ion, X³⁺, which contains 55 electrons. In which block of the periodic table would element X be found?
Which of the following decreases when an aqueous solution of ethanoic acid is diluted?
Which of the following statements is not true?
questions.choiceA: A: 0.1 mol l⁻¹ hydrochloric acid has a hydrogen ion concentration of 0.1 mol l⁻¹.
questions.choiceB: B: 20.0 cm³ of 0.1 mol l⁻¹ sodium hydroxide is exactly neutralised by 20.0 cm³ of 0.1 mol l⁻¹ ethanoic acid.
questions.choiceC: C: The pH of 0.1 mol l⁻¹ hydrochloric acid is lower than that of 0.1 mol l⁻¹ ethanoic acid.
questions.choiceD: D: The Kₐ value for ethanoic acid is greater than that of hydrochloric acid.

questions.text: The standard enthalpy of formation of strontium chloride is the enthalpy change for
Which of the following alcohols would have the greatest entropy at 90 ºC?
The order of a reactant in a reaction
questions.choiceA: A: can only be obtained by experiment
questions.choiceB: B: determines the speed of the overall reaction
questions.choiceC: C: is determined by the stoichiometry involved
questions.choiceD: D: is the sequence of steps in the reaction mechanism.

questions.text: Which of the following compounds will react with both dilute hydrochloric acid and sodium hydroxide solution?
